Package jpass.crypt.io

Class CryptInputStream

java.lang.Object
java.io.InputStream
jpass.crypt.io.CryptInputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class CryptInputStream
extends InputStream
Reads from an encrypted InputStream and provides the decrypted data. The encryption key is provided with the constructor. The initialization vector can also be provided. Otherwise this vector is read from the stream.
Version:
$Revision: 1.5 $
Author:
Timm Knape

  • Field Details

    • FETCH_BUFFER_SIZE

      private static final int FETCH_BUFFER_SIZE
      Maximum size of data that will be read from the underlying stream.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • _parent

      private final InputStream _parent
      Underlying stream that provides the encrypted data.

    • _cipher

      private final Cbc _cipher
      Cipher.

    • _decrypted

      private final ByteArrayOutputStream _decrypted

    • _buffer

      private byte[] _buffer
      Buffer of unencrypted data. If the buffer is completely returned, another chunk of data will be decrypted.

    • _bufferUsed

      private int _bufferUsed
      Number of bytes that are already returned from _buffer.

    • _fetchBuffer

      private final byte[] _fetchBuffer
      Buffer for storing the encrypted data.

    • _lastBufferRead

      private boolean _lastBufferRead
      Signals, if the last encrypted data was read. If we run out of buffers, the stream is at its end.

  • Constructor Details

    • CryptInputStream

      public CryptInputStream​(InputStream parent, byte[] key, byte[] iv)
      Creates a cipher with the key and iv provided.
      Parameters:
      parent - Stream that provides the encrypted data
      key - key for the cipher algorithm
      iv - initial values for the CBC scheme

    • CryptInputStream

      public CryptInputStream​(InputStream parent, byte[] key) throws IOException
      Creates a cipher with the key. The iv will be read from the parent stream. If there are not enough bytes in the stream, an IOException will be raised.
      Parameters:
      parent - Stream that provides the encrypted data
      key - key for the cipher algorithm
      Throws:
      IOException - if the iv can't be read

  • Method Details

    • readFromStream

      private void readFromStream()
      Tries to read the next decrypted data from the output stream

    • read

      public int read() throws IOException
      Returns the next decrypted byte. If there is no more data, -1 will be returned. If the decryption fails or the underlying stream throws an IOException, an IOException will be thrown.
      Specified by:
      read in class InputStream
      Returns:
      next decrypted byte or -1
      Throws:
      IOException - if the decryption fails or the underlying stream throws an exception

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Closes the parent stream.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable
      Overrides:
      close in class InputStream
      Throws:
      IOException - if the parent stream throws an exception
